meanings.definition: To fasten with nails driven slantingly.
meanings.sent1: He was toenailing the loose board to the floor.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was toenailing the trim to the wall.
meanings.sent3: She tried toenailing the picture frame to the wall, but it ended up crooked.
meanings.sent4: The idea of toenailing the shelf to the ceiling seemed absurd.
meanings.sent5: Toenailing the fence together made it sturdy and secure.

meanings.definition: To secure or strengthen by driving nails obliquely.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker was toenailing the beams for extra support.
meanings.sent2: Toenailing the joints together made the structure more stable.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly suggested toenailing the bookshelf to the ceiling for added security.
meanings.sent4: The concept of toenailing friendships to build a strong bond is intriguing.
meanings.sent5: Toenailing the pieces together created a durable and reliable structure.
